intro: Coleosanthus ambigens, commonly known as the ambiguous sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Coleosanthus ambigens thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to salty, humid environments.
